result.execSummary:
The defendant Abdulah Khalil was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).
  • Robbery with Threat of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
$50.00 to Pick N Save 8701 S. 27 Street, Milwaukee, WI.  Restitution to Sentry Foods at 9210 W. Lisbon, Milwaukee, WI. to be determined at hearing on June 16, 2015.  Restitution to be paid first.
*6/16/2015  to pay $663.00 to Sentry Foods.  To be taken by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Any remaining amounts due and owing would be paid while on Extended Supervision.

FOR BOTH COUNTS:  Pay DNA surcharge, costs, surcharges and disbursements.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  all monies to be taken by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Balances to be paid while on Extended supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.

superMiscConds.notes:
Be given literacy training.
Obtain GED.
Seek and maintain employment.   Be given job and vocational training.

No contact with Sentry at 9210 W. Lisbon Avenue, Milwaukee, WI.
No contact with Pick N Save at 3701 S. 27 Street, Milwaukee, WI.
No controlled substances other than those legally prescribed for defendant by a duly licensed and only for as long as deemed medically reasonable and necessary.
No alcohol.

AODA assessment and treatment.  Urine screens.
*Conditions of Extended Supervision apply to both counts/case.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
The Court advised defendant  that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor; further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one. Credit for 100 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Abdulah Khalil

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING (20 pages) commencing APRIL 30, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Abdulah Khalil in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton who appeared by telephone.  Defendant Abdulah Khalil in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   State advised the court that the monies in dispute have been withdrawn and that they have reached a stipulation that the defendant pay $663.00 to Sentry Foods to be taken by the Department of Corrections from up to 25% of prison funds.  Any remaining amounts due and owing would be paid while on Extended Supervision.  All other conditions of sentence remain.
Defense Memorandum on Sentencing, received and filed.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Abdulah Khalil not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Branch 20 in trial.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing before Branch 20.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Abdulah Khalil in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Abdulah Khalil in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing proceeds.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty of Counts 1 and 2 as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   Defense counsel requested a separate sentencing date; private PSI to be ordered.  Court granted defense request and ordered case adjourned before Branch 20.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Abdulah Khalil not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Branch 20 in trial.  Due to lateness in hour, defense counsel unable to stay.  Case is rescheduled.  File retained in court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.  File retained court.
ADA Frisch is unavailable on 3/27/15 and requested another date.  Parties stipulate to 3/24/15 at 1:30 p.m. for plea.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Abdulah Khalil not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared on behalf of James W. Frisch for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another plea date.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defense motion for modification of bail heard and denied.

Defendant Abdulah Khalil in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Abdulah Khalil in custody.  Ron Dague for James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with PENNY M. ALL SENTRY FOOD STORES; AND  WILLIAM M. ALL PICK N' SAVE STORES
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Abdulah Khalil in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Abdulah Khalil in custody.  William Nathaniel Gale Barron appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
